results.content:
Disclaimer - I'm an experienced developer and about 10 years ago I taught .NET & SQL Server.  Haven't had a chance recently to review the latest & greatest versions.

That said, this is an excellent course for beginners & novices; more experienced folks; will likely pick up a few tricks, too as I did.  

It's ambitious to cover this much in a single course and in only 13 hours, Tom did a great job.  Keep in mind each of these technologies literally take years to master, but this is a great start.
results.content_html:
Disclaimer - I'm an experienced developer and about 10 years ago I taught .NET & SQL Server. Haven't had a chance recently to review the latest & greatest versions.

That said, this is an excellent course for beginners & novices; more experienced folks; will likely pick up a few tricks, too as I did.

It's ambitious to cover this much in a single course and in only 13 hours, Tom did a great job. Keep in mind each of these technologies literally take years to master, but this is a great start.

results.content:
I am very happy that Tom is teaching this material.
He is the only instructor that I have found who is teaching this at all. For me, I am very grateful. 
I don't quite get it all yet, however. I am following along doing the steps, which is a bit like a baby regergitating words that he has been taught, but I don't have complete understanding yet. When I follow Tom's examples, the code works, but when I try to edit or alter it to meet my specific needs, I have problems that take me hours to work through in solving. This shows that I don't have an understanding mastery of the material yet. Could be me however.

response.content:

That's how I improved. 
Just stay with it to the end, and you'll see it click together eventually.

response.content:
Hello,
Thank you for anything positive you have to say. 
That makes a difference. 

Dear friends, before enrolling, please be sure you have done the following: 
1. Read the course description carefully
2. Watched the free preview videos
3. If the videos seem blurry, the connection might be slow. 
4. Please reload the video or try again later. I cannot control that. 
5. Please read the course goals carefully to be sure it's what you need. 
6. LIke you, I have a job, so my videos are made after 10 hours of work. Please keep that in mind. 
7. I'm very careful when I explain things, so the videos are on average 13 minutes long.
response.content_html:

7. I'm very careful when I explain things, so the videos are on average 13 minutes long.

results.content: There's a lot of good information in this course, and Tom is clearly very good at what he does. Honestly, though, it's very difficult for me to get through these videos. Tom's presentation style is pretty monotone, flat-affect and rather slow. I watch them at 1.5x - 2x speed, but the quality of audio is rather poor and "reverberates" sometimes at that speed. Great content, but the presentation is not engaging for me, so I don't think I'm getting as much out of this as I'd like.

response.content:
Hi Michael,
Thank you for your feedback. 
I've taken your ideas into account as I have replaced 67 of the 84 videos in the course. 
New Visitors: 
Please be sure to listen to the free previews to see the updated course. 
It's important to go through the whole course to see everything it has to offer. 
Tom
11/3/2017

results.content:
The instructor does two things that make this series ROCK. First, he makes typos, leaving out a quote mark or a comma or adding an extra comma. Second, he types a query where he knows there is an error to show you what will happen. 

He also explains what is happening and why, does not leave the student to have to guess what is going on. 

And as a bonus, he does something that way too many programmers forget to do, he adds in comments!
results.content_html:

And as a bonus, he does something that way too many programmers forget to do, he adds in comments!

results.content:
This is an extraordinary course in SQL Server.
It takes you from zero and methodically brings you to coding procedures with input/output parameters, transactions with saving points and integrating SQL databases into a website project. 
The explanations given in the video leave almost no room for unanswered questions. 
The slow pace and clarity of the explanations sometimes allow you to write the code simultaneously with the instructor. 

There is so much good and detailed information in this course, that after finishing it I still feel the need of recapping the material and the finer points. 

I don't have any criticism regarding this course.
results.content_html:
This is an extraordinary course in SQL Server.
It takes you from zero and methodically brings you to coding procedures with input/output parameters, transactions with saving points and integrating SQL databases into a website project.
The explanations given in the video leave almost no room for unanswered questions.
The slow pace and clarity of the explanations sometimes allow you to write the code simultaneously with the instructor.

There is so much good and detailed information in this course, that after finishing it I still feel the need of recapping the material and the finer points.

I don't have any criticism regarding this course.

results.content: I have had this course for 2 years.  I continue to refer back to it as I develop my small company's web based forms.  I use the page to replace paper forms and excel spreadsheets.  I wish It would have shown intro to actual IIS right up front and built the page from there.  IIS express will not let other computers on a network access the page.  I recommend viewers students also taking a class on installing and setup of actual IIS before this course.

results.content:
For a beginner, SQL is a very tough subject. 

Furthermore, SQL is only part of the core subject matter. You also learn Visual Studio 2017 (which gives you unlimited opportunities) and IIS.  However, Tom is a very good teacher because he goes through each point step by step. Hence, he made tough topics easier. 

Overall, I wanted to use my own database on the internet. To do so, I completed several Access 2016 courses and no teacher could tell me how to run Access online. So I wish I had decided to take Tom's course earlier.

For a newbie, the course will take more than 18 hours. But its worth it.

response.content:
Hi Alan,
Thank you for doing a careful, thoughtful and mature review. I appreciate it.
response.content_html:

results.content_html:
For a beginner, SQL is a very tough subject.

Furthermore, SQL is only part of the core subject matter. You also learn Visual Studio 2017 (which gives you unlimited opportunities) and IIS. However, Tom is a very good teacher because he goes through each point step by step. Hence, he made tough topics easier.

Overall, I wanted to use my own database on the internet. To do so, I completed several Access 2016 courses and no teacher could tell me how to run Access online. So I wish I had decided to take Tom's course earlier.

For a newbie, the course will take more than 18 hours. But its worth it.

results.content: In fact this has been one of the most valuable course on the Udemy backboard. I did really like the small tricks and the real world examples that was generated. I sincerely recommend this course for all beginners because it combines ASP.NET, other functionalities with SQL. I also like the way he explains the lectures with less coding and exploring the power of the visual studio and SQL. Thanks.  It worth the time and energy you put in developing this course.

Dear friends, before enrolling, please be sure you have done the following:

2. Watched the free preview videos
3. If the videos seem blurry, the connection might be slow. 
4. Please reload the video or try again later. I cannot control that. 
5. Please read the course goals carefully to be sure it's what you need. 
6. LIke you, I have a job, so my videos are made after 10 hours of work. Please keep that in mind. 
7. I'm very careful when I explain things, so the videos are on average 13 minutes long.

results.content:
I have completed a couple of courses presented by Tom, the instructor. He is a very good teacher who takes a very hands on and practical approach to the subject matter so that you can understand the concepts and techniques in a real world context. He shows numerous examples of a given concept throughout the course, demonstrating its practical application. 

I feel that I have gained a lot of useful knowledge from the courses I have studied so far from this instructor and I am looking forward to gaining more understanding and practical skills in SQL Server Application Development by completing this course.

Having now finished this course I am amazed at the breadth of material covered. Many of the individual lectures could serve as the basis for an entire course. When covering so many different topics, it is impossible in one course to explore all of them in depth. Fortunately, the instructor has additional courses available that provide a deep dive into particular topics.

The instructor responds quickly to queries and comments and provides clarifications of arcane and difficult to grasp concepts so that students can gain a better understanding of the material being presented.

The instructor sometimes will deliberately do something that will cause an error or unexpected behavior, so that students will be aware of common "gotchas" and learn to avoid them when coding their own projects. This is a very useful and effective pedagogic tool.

I highly recommend this course and am looking forward to taking many more courses with this instructor. You should, too!

results.content:
Poor sound recording quality and monotone voice combine to put me to sleep within an hour.The examples used could be improved in a couple ways. One being that we should be given some sort of reasoning as to why we might be trying to do something. Then talk us through the logical thought process that goes in to determining how we will query and why. The instructor often just copies his own code without explaining well why were are typing what we're typing.

 Also, the volume levels vary from video to video with a few of them being almost too quiet to hear at full volume.

results.content: Good course!  The instructor was very knowledgeable about the topic.  The course is primarily based on the back-end coding, but I would have liked to see a little more in regards to the front-end as well.  The instructor worked at a good pace, and it was easy to follow and understand.  Only qualm was that the sound (I watched on my phone), was really low.  I had to crank up the volume.  Other than that, great job!
results.content_html: Good course! The instructor was very knowledgeable about the topic. The course is primarily based on the back-end coding, but I would have liked to see a little more in regards to the front-end as well. The instructor worked at a good pace, and it was easy to follow and understand. Only qualm was that the sound (I watched on my phone), was really low. I had to crank up the volume. Other than that, great job!

results.content: I can appreciate the course is 3 years old, and a lot can change in 3 years.  I have expected a bit more on the Visual Studio side of things.  There are a lot of SQL examples, but the examples are (most of the time) just the instructor retyping code.  There needs to be a theme.  Like anything, I think the examples should follow each other.  Rather than just starting to type code, explain the problem, so the person viewing the video understands what you're trying to achieve.  By just starting to type code, it doesn't really explain the reasons behind it.  The course also had no videos on how to configure user login and registration.  There is a whole section on setting up users on SQL, but that doesn't help when the aim is to build a secure web application to allow users to log on, which these examples are not.  The instructor will also benefit from a faster computer - sitting and waiting for code to run is not a good look, and the use of "small talk" throughout the videos should be avoided.  Overall, it was value for money, I learnt a lot, and will continue on my VS journey.

results.content:
Advantages: I used this course to recover my knowledge of SQL. I have not been working with relational databases for several years, but these skills were necessary for a new job. For this purpose, this course approached me, so I mark it as – 4 stars.

Disadvantages: however, the author is not very competent, does not adhere to the naming convention (very bad!), does not understand the C# (what was the reason for doing some examples in C#?), and few more inaccuracies, especially in the quizzes.  Many videos have been recorded since the first attempt, due to which they have errors that the author simply signed the comments.
Also, and as a result, the course has a problem with positioning – for whom exactly was it created? Therefore, from this side, I mark it as – 3 stars.

response.content:
Hi Oleg,
Thank you for the review. 
I do have it clearly stated in my course description that this course uses C# for many lessons so the student can see the practical connection of SQL and ASP.NET. 
Did you read the course description carefully? 
It lists all the many different features of the course. 
Did you type and run all the code examples as I do, line by line? 
That's the key to getting the most out of this course. 
If there are any specific quiz question issues, please let me know. 
I can double check those. 
Please remember this is a big course, and I'm only one person.
Please
response.content_html:
Hi Oleg,
Thank you for the review.
I do have it clearly stated in my course description that this course uses C# for many lessons so the student can see the practical connection of SQL and ASP.NET.
Did you read the course description carefully?
It lists all the many different features of the course.
Did you type and run all the code examples as I do, line by line?
That's the key to getting the most out of this course.
If there are any specific quiz question issues, please let me know.
I can double check those.
Please remember this is a big course, and I'm only one person.
Please

Disadvantages: however, the author is not very competent, does not adhere to the naming convention (very bad!), does not understand the C# (what was the reason for doing some examples in C#?), and few more inaccuracies, especially in the quizzes. Many videos have been recorded since the first attempt, due to which they have errors that the author simply signed the comments.
Also, and as a result, the course has a problem with positioning – for whom exactly was it created? Therefore, from this side, I mark it as – 3 stars.

results.content: Tom speaks clearly and gives plenty of examples while teaching. He also has simple quizzes interspersed between the videos to help reinforce the learning. Its a lot to take in and he urges you to practice, practice, practice. Great course...

results.content_html: Tom speaks clearly and gives plenty of examples while teaching. He also has simple quizzes interspersed between the videos to help reinforce the learning. Its a lot to take in and he urges you to practice, practice, practice. Great course...

results.content: This course is excellent! Explains a lot of what is going on with SQL and why. I do suggest not to watch the closed captions, as they are sometimes incorrect. I found it best to listen in headphones, with SSMS in one window with adventureworks loaded, and the class in the other.  I found myself replaying some of the lectures for better understanding and trying things on my own. I think this course is good for the novice but also for the more advanced who are looking to strengthen their skills.
results.content_html: This course is excellent! Explains a lot of what is going on with SQL and why. I do suggest not to watch the closed captions, as they are sometimes incorrect. I think this course is good for the novice but also for the more advanced who are looking to strengthen their skills.

results.content: If you need to learn sql server - start here.  Tom has got a great presentation style that quickly gets you to where you need to be.  This course also benefits from ASP integration as well i.e. get a web page to talk to sql server with as little coding as possible.  Great Job, Tom.

results.content: He does a good job explaining things, offering concise information in each lecture. However, he could stand to slow down just a little bit. But really that's my only gripe. Good course all in all.

results.content: The instructor goes into very deep detail and is very good about going into every aspect of the tools we're working with and all the ways you can use them. I've been pretty impressed with the course so far. As with everything else related to development, some things he does may not work in exactly the same way when you attempt to apply them to your specific project, espcially if you're working with a corporate database with different data structures and namespaces than his fairly simple one, so you may need to play around with some things on your own when things don't work out as expected, but solving problems like that is why machines haven't replaced us yet.

results.content: Excellent teaching style in this course. The instructor continually reinforces the value of building skills in steps, using what you learned over and over on top of what you are learning. This is a very effective teaching and learning method. The more this method is followed the more competent an analyst becomes.

results.content: I have thoroughly enjoyed all of Tom's courses. I have completed his 16 hour C#course, am about halfway through his Windows Form driven course, and bought this course completely based on my experience with the others. I am currently a student in programming my professors have been wowed at my advanced knowledge of C# and coding principals and I owe that completely to these courses. I am soon to wow my new boss with my knowledge of SQL Management Studio with Tom's help. Keep up the awesome work!
